intro: Gnaphalium stenocladum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cudweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It features small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in dense clusters, with narrow, linear leaves. Its botanical structure supports its role in local ecosystems, providing habitat and nectar for pollinators.
